meanings.sent1: The bird was outflying the others in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The superhero's cape allowed him to outflying any aircraft.
meanings.sent3: The tiny butterfly was outflying the big eagle, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were outflying reality, reaching heights never imagined.
meanings.sent5: The rocket was outflying towards the stars, leaving a trail of light behind.

meanings.definition: To fly faster or farther than.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah was outflying the gazelle in the race.
meanings.sent2: The jet plane was outflying the storm, reaching safety in no time.
meanings.sent3: The kite was outflying the clouds, dancing in the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were outflying his actions, always a step ahead.
meanings.sent5: The eagle was outflying the wind, gliding effortlessly through the air.

meanings.sent1: The peregrine falcon was outflying all other birds in the competition.
meanings.sent2: The drone was outflying its competitors, capturing stunning aerial footage.
meanings.sent3: The paper airplane was outflying the expectations, soaring higher than imagined.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was outflying reality, creating worlds beyond belief.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon was outflying the clouds, floating gracefully in the sky.
